characters: EXT. ROOFTOP, TALL BUILDING, GOTHAM --. LATER
GRADUATION... PARTYING WITH FRIENDS... KISSING HER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO RUSSIAN WARSHIPS, the ANATOLE and the CASSIOPEIA, approach a RUSSIAN OIL RIG in ARCTIC WATERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karpov 60, an INTIMIDATING RUSSIAN GENERAL, CAPTAINS the WARSHIP. His SECOND IN COMMAND UMINSKI, 30's, stands at h side.

dialogues.speaker: KARPOV
dialogues.text: (to Uminski, in Russian) Hold this position.

dialogues.speaker: UMINSKI
dialogues.text: Yes General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 300 RUSSIAN OIL RIG WORKERS are held PRISONER in the CARG HOLD of the RUSSIAN OIL RIG. They are surrounded by a ATLANTEAN HIJACKERS. The Atlante wear a combination of BLACK WET SUITS and ARMOR PLATING designed like FISH SCALES. Their faces are CONCEALED behi MASKS. Their HANDS and FEET are BARE. They wield STRANGE WEAPONRY which HUM with ENERGY. OKSANA, 40's, A HARDENED FEMALE OIL RIG WORKER cradles a frightened YOUNGER FEMALE OIL RIG WORKER, LUCYA, early 20 who SOBS in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: OKSANA
dialogues.text: (in Russian) It's Ok. It's Ok. MERA, a TALL, BEAUTIFUL REDHEAD ATLANTEAN walks past them and speaks with one of her Warriors. He BOWS to her and leaves. She walks towards a TALL MAN with LONG FLOWING hair who s on top of a stack of CRATES like a King on a THRONE. He i dressed in ARMOR. In his right hand he holds a LONG GOLDE TRIDENT. His left hand is SHIMMERING and BLUE as if MADE WATER. This is ORIN, KING OF THE ATLANTEANS.

dialogues.speaker: MERA
dialogues.text: (in Atlantean) Orin. The surface dwellers approach. Orin steps off the crates which are marked 'MERREVALE'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Atlantean) Order the Warriors to set the charges.

dialogues.speaker: MERA
dialogues.text: And the prisoners?

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: They are pawns. When the charges are set put them in their life boats and release them. (he smiles) In the meantime let us welcome our guests. He leaves the Cargo Hold. Mera stays to watch over the Hostages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO RUSSIAN HELICOPTERS hover above the MAIN PLATFORM. A SQUAD of TWELVE RUSSIAN COMMANDOES rappel down onto the Platform their MACHINE GUNS raised and ready. Orin emerges onto the Platform followed by a squad of his WARRIORS who carry with them LARGE CANNON-LIKE WEAPONS.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: Get in formation. I'll attend to these. The King walks towards the Commandoes who AIM their GUNS him.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDO LEADER
dialogues.text: (firmly, in Russian) Drop your weapons and get down on your knees!

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: (in Russian) I kneel before no one. He SLAMS the HILT of his Trident DOWN. A COMMANDO notices an Atlantean Warrior placing a CANNON RAIL at the EDGE of the PLATFORM and pointing it towards Warships.

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: The Commando FIRES his weapon. The Bullets BOUNCE of the Atlantean armor but one PENETRATES the Warrior's leg. He BUCKLES and FALLS to his knees. With SUPERHUMAN speed Orin ATTACKS before the Commandos c even REACT.  3. He JUMPS high into the air and LANDS in the MIDDLE of the Commandos. With LETHAL EFFICIENCY he DISPATCHES the Commandos. SLICI their ARMS and STABBING them THROUGH the LEGS with his TRIDENT. He KICKS the Commando Leader CLEAR ACROSS the platform as the rest fall to the floor DISABLED and in PAIN but ALIVE The King turns to his Warriors and nods.

dialogues.speaker: OPEN FIRE
dialogues.text: The Warriors place the CANNONS on the RAIL and FIRE on th Anatole. BLUE BOLTS of DESTRUCTIVE ENERGY fire towards the Warship The Energy IMPACTS the HULLS of the Ship sending WAVES of ENERGY through the vessel which INCAPACITATES the CREW wh CRUMBLE to the floor, UNCONSCIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karpov sees the other Warship being DISABLED.

dialogues.speaker: KARPOV
dialogues.text: (to Uminski) Call in the Fighters. Uminski activates his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE RUSSIAN T-50 FIGHTER JETS fly high above the Arctic waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT listens to his orders.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: What are my orders?

dialogues.speaker: UMINSKI, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Request immediate attack. Terminate the hostiles.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Affirmit... The Pilot pauses as he sees SOMETHING outside of the COCKPIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two FAMILIAR RED BOOTS walk up the NOSE of the Jet toward the cockpit. The Pilot looks up as a RED CAPE BILLOWS outside the Jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uminski and Karpov watch as the T-50 fly past without completing the Airstrike.

dialogues.speaker: UMINSKI
dialogues.text: (into radio) Request immediate attack. Repeat Immediate attack. There is no response

dialogues.speaker: UMINSKI, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: No response sir. Karpov SUCKS his teeth and PONDERS his options. Uminski looks to the sky and his eyes WIDEN.

dialogues.speaker: UMINSKI
dialogues.text: (shocked) Sir! Karpov looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin and his Warriors look to the sky as they hear the CR of a SONIC BOOM. A RED and BLUE BLUR CRASHES down through the COMPLEX.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Sky Dweller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Red and Blue blur SMASHES down through the CEILING an down onto the FLOOR. The Hostages SCREAM and COWER as the Atlanteans raise the ENERGY WEAPONS. Mera CALMLY steps backwards and takes COVER behind a BULKHEAD DOOR and WATCHES. The DEBRIS and DUST settle and standing on the DENTED flo in the middle of the Cargo Hold between the Hostages and Atlanteans is the MAN OF STEEL, KAL EL... SUPERMAN. An Atlantean Warrior RUSHES Superman with his Weapon RAIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) I'd put those toys away. Superman GRABS the BARREL of the Weapon and CRUSHES it wi EASE. The other Atlanteans OPEN FIRE. BOLTS of CRACKLING BLUE ENERGY strike Superman REPEATEDLY. He STAGGERS back as th energy PASSES THROUGH his BODY. He SHAKES it off.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (bemused) That's new. Superman tries to pull the Weapon away from the Atlantean But to the Kryptonian's SURPRISE the Warrior RESISTS. The Warrior seems to be SMILING beneath his Mask. Superman PULLS harder and the Atlantean is YANKED OFF his feet entirely and TOSSED aside. Superman then with SUPERHUMAN SPEED attacks the remaining Warriors as they OPEN FIRE on his again. He DEFLECTS their ENERGY BOLTS and DISARMS them DESTROYIN their Weapons and SCATTERING their parts across the Cargo Hold. He CRISS-CROSSES the interior of the complex SUBDUING the Warriors before coming to a HALT in front of the Hostages They RECOIL from him and COWER

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid. (reaches out his hand) I'm here to help. Lucya stands up and walks up to the Man of Steel and look into his KIND EYES and places her hand in his.

dialogues.speaker: LUCYA
dialogues.text: (in English) There are others.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: I know. I'll take care of them. Can you lead these people to the life boats? She nods. Superman smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (to Mera) I'm giving you once chance to surrender. That's more than those Warships will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English) How many chances will they give you? Superman looks up through the HOLE in the Rig's Roof. Standing above him LOOKING DOWN upon him is Orin.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: Before they kill you? Superman LIFTS of the floor and FLOATS up through the hol and HOVERS over Orin before LANDING to face him.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: They only killers here are you and your terrorists. Disarm the bombs you've planted.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: I don't kill without justification. (gestures to the Warships) Unlike them.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: The people here are innocent.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: And I will release them and (gestures to the rig) destroy this abomination.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: I can't allow you to do that.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: Their machines poison my oceans. Ruin the Earth. There is nothing of this world but rot, decay and death. (points Trident at Superman) And you would be it's champion?

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: I would be it's protector.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: Why? Humans hate what they don't understand and they can never understand someone like you. (softly) I know this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been destroying oil installations all over the planet. This has to stop.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: I will never stop. I do this to protect my people like you protect theirs. Superman sees Atlanteans on the Platform CHARGING up thei ENERGY CANNONS. Before they can fire Superman uses his HEAT VISION to DESTROY the Cannons. The Warriors are sent HURTLING backwards from the BLAST. Orin STRIKES Superman across the JAW with the HILT of his TRIDENT and then STABS it toward his CHEST. Superman CATCHES the Trident as Orin LUNGES forward DRIVI Superman backwards. Superman STEADIES himself. He looks at Orin's SHIMMERING LEFT HAND.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: (confused) What are you?

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: More like you than they can ever be. Superman GRIPS the Trident and SWING Orin over his head a SMASHES him down INTO the Platform floor. Orin FLIPS to his feet and SLICES the Trident ACROSS Superman's CHEST cutting THREE SLASHES In his SYMBOL OF HOPE. Superman and Orin CHARGE at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uminski watches as Superman and Orin BATTLE on top of the PLATFORM. Karpov is on the radio awaiting orders.

dialogues.speaker: UMINSKI
dialogues.text: (to himself, in awe) They are Gods! Karpov receives his orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Uminski) Open fire on the installation.

dialogues.speaker: UMINSKI
dialogues.text: (reluctant) That would sink it. There are 300 civilians on board.

dialogues.speaker: KARPOV
dialogues.text: You have your orders. Uminski takes a DEEP BREATH.

dialogues.speaker: UMINSKI
dialogues.text: (firmly) No. Karpov turns gestures TWO SAILORS to REMOVE Uminski from Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: KARPOV
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Get this coward out of here! Uminski is ESCORTED out.

dialogues.speaker: KARPOV
dialogues.text: (firmly) Open fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orin is sent. SKIDDING backwards across the Platform. He STABS his Trident into the FLOOR to stop his MOMENTUM. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: You're holding back.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: Because I don't want to kill you. The ROAR of ARTILLERY FIRE fills the AIR. A SHELLS impact the Installation. The EXPLOSIONS SHAKE th Oil Rig. Another Shell DETONATES between Superman and Orin SEPARAT them. Superman JUMPS into the air and FLIES toward the Warship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karpov sees the Man of Steel approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) Fire! Fire! Fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Warship OPEN FIRE on Superman who PUNCHES the SHELLS from the sky and FLIES over the Warship and uses his HEAT VISION to DESTROY the ARTILLERY CANNONS and then DIVES do through the BRIDGE. Karpov THROWS himself to the floor on impact. Superman stands over the TERRIFIED General. Before he can anything he HEARS the SCREAMING of the Oil Rig Workers. He leaves and flies back towards the CRIPPLED Rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lands inside and lands in a SMOKING HALLWAY. He HEARS someone STRUGGLING. He SWIFTLY follows the sound Mera is PINNED beneath a fallen BULKHEAD DOOR. Her STOMAC has been WOUNDED. She's BLEEDING HEAVILY. Superman LIFTS the DOOR off of her and TAKES her in his a and FLIES her out of the Hallway and out onto the Platfor He lays her down gently.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: I can help you. Please trust me. He uses his HEAT VISION to CAUTERIZE the wound. She GRITS her teeth trying not to scream. Superman finishes and she goes LIMP. Superman looks up from Mera and sees Orin WATCHING him. Behind him his Warriors stand WEAPONS READY and AIMED at Man of Steel. Superman stands.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: She needs help. Take her and leave. Orin STRAPS his Trident ACROSS HIS BACK and lifts Mera GENTLY in his arms. As he leaves he looks back on Superman for a moment. Orin DIVES OFF the Platform and into the Ocean and SWIMS AMAZING SPEED into the DEPTHS. His Warriors follow. Suddenly the 0il Rig is ROCKED by a huge EXPLOSION at it' BASE and begins to TILT and SINK into the Ocean.  10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water RUSHES into the Cargo Hold and ENGULFS the Workers. Oksana grabs Lucya and stops her from being DRAGGED away the CURRENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superman FLIES up into the sky then DOWN INTO the OCEAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Workers are totally SUBMERGED and and SECONDS away fr DEATH. The Oil Rig SHAKES and the Water levels begin to DROP. Th Workers GASP for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Oil Rig RISES from the OCEAN carried by Superman who slowly carries it to the nearby ICEBERG and places it dow as SOFTLY as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Workers SCREAM as the Oil Rig LANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superman BREATHS HEAVILY.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: Why are you here? Orin stands behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: Leave them. They will destroy you if you don't. Superman faces the King.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: It's their nature. The Workers start to flow out of the Oil Rig. Superman looks towards the Warships and walks past Orin.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: You'd better hope we don't meet again. Superman LEAPS into the air and flies toward the Warship. Orin watches him as he departs.  11.

dialogues.speaker: ORIN
dialogues.text: (respectful) We will brother. We will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CREW of the Warship, including Karpov and Uminski, ar on the deck. Superman lands on the Deck and MARCHES toward Karpov.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (angry) вЂ” There were 300 innocent people on that Rig!

dialogues.speaker: KARPOV
dialogues.text: (in Russian, terrified) Sorry! Sorry! Sorry Superman pauses.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: (to Crew) Does anyone speak English? Uminski RAISES his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: Those people need help and medical attention. See that they get it. Uminksi nods and relays Superman's orders to the Crew.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (to Uminski) Who ordered the attack? Uminski doesn't say anything but LOOKS towards Karpov.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Karpov yells OBSCENITIES in Russian. He has been WRAPPED in the METAL REMAINS of the Warship's BRIDGE. His feet HA comically above the DECK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oksana and Lucya watch as Superman disappears into the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: LUCYA
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Superman.  12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superman flies HIGH above the Arctic PICKING UP SPEED as comes towards the PACIFIC OCEAN and skims at SUPER SONIC SPEED across the water. He SPINS as he gains ALTITUDE and enters the STRATOSPHERE BREAKING the SOUND BARRIER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superman SLOWS DOWN as he looks upon THE EARTH. He takes the sight for a moment before descending back towards the UNITED STATES. Floating in the distance is a LEXCORP SATELLITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN sits cross legged on a desk in a DARK ROOM with his back to us. He is a BLACK SILHOUETTE against an array of COMPUTER SCREENS which are MONITORING the scene in the Arctic and showing BLURRED IMAGES of Superman flying through space. The screens go BLANK and the room goes BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha Kent walks toward the BARN. Her dog jumps is by he side. She opens the BARN DOORS and enters. She tries to PULL OP the TRAP DOOR when the Dog starts barking and she hears a familiar SWOOSHING sound.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: (smiles) How come you always show up at dinner? Standing in the doorway is her son Superman... CLARK KENT

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Good timing.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Sure (tugs on the trap door) Well don't just stand there. Help me with this. Her Son smiles and PULLS the trap door open and they both walk down the steps into the DARK ROOM below. Martha switches on the LIGHT and REVEALS the room which i VERY DIFFERENT from when it used to conceal Clark's  13. SPACECRAFT. PASTED to the WALLS are HUNDREDS of NEWSPAPER CLIPPINGS o her son's EXPLOITS all around the world.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: You've been busy.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: I come down her a lot these days. I'm turning into your father. (smiles) When he wanted to be alone he'd come down here. It was his fortress of solitude. Clark sees an OLD FRAMED PHOTO of himself and his FATHER the workbench. He picks it up and stares at it LONGINGLY. It's clear he STILL misses him. Martha leans her head against his shoulder and looks at t photo.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: He'd have been so proud of you Clark. He was proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I know. (puts the photo back down and looks around at all the clippings) If only the rest of the world shared his opinion.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: They will. They just don't understand you right now. Or what happened with Zod. Clark's face HARDENS at the mention of Zod.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: Look around you. Look at all the great things you've done and the people you've helped.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: But you've only put up the good things they say about me.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Clark, honey. If I were to use the bad things they say I could cover the barn, the house and the outhouse.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: We still have an outhouse?  14. They laugh. Martha HUGS Clark and lays her head against his TORN SYMB of HOPE.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Things will change. Someday the whole world will see you for what you are. Just like I do. And your Father did.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: When you say it I believe it.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: That's right. (loosens her grip and looks him in the eyes) Now let me fix you some dinner.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: That's Ok Mom.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Oh can it. We do this every time. I already have a plate out.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (laughs) Ok. Ok. She lets him go and starts to MARCH up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: And take off that damn beat up suit. No capes at the table.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Elvis wore a cape. You love Elvis.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Elvis was Elvis. He could wear anything. Clark smiles and follows his Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark, dressed in a SHIRT and JEANS, is in the KITCHEN washing the dishes while Martha sits on the couch in the living room watching a TALK SHOW.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Hurry up Clark. Lois is on. Clark puts the final dish down and walks to the LIVING RO and leans against the door frame.  15. On the television TV talk show host CAT GRANT. A BUXOM BLONDE with an ICE WHITE smile hosts a DEBATE between LOI LANE and MORGAN EDGE, a SLICK YOUNG PR EXECUTIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat SMILES at the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Good Evening. I'm Cat Grant and joining me tonight on our panel is Pulitzer Prize winning reporter for the Daily Planet Lois Lane.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: Glad to be here Cat.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: (impressed) She looks good on TV.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: And to her left is Morgan Edge, PR executive to Metropolis' own LexCorp. The world's leading conglomerate and a virtual economy all by itself. Lovely to have you here.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: Always a pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: So Lois I'll start with you. It's been almost a year since the attack on Metropolis and in that time you have been a very vocal proponent in the media for the being known as Kal El as an ally to Earth.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: I believe Kal El is being portrayed unfairly in the global media and as a witness to what transpired before and after the events in Metropolis I have no doubt in my mind that Kal El can and will aid humanity in ways that I understand the population are finding difficult to accept right now.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Morgan, you and LexCorp have a different view point.  16.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: We share the same view as the majority of the world in that there is no evidence that this 'Superman' isn't a very real threat to the safety of every single human life on this planet.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: I disagree. Just look at the good works he's done not just in the U.S but around the world in the last year.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: By good works do you mean breaking international law and causing incident after incident. Cat, just tonight we are getting reports that he attacked Russian Military personnel in Russian waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha looks at Clark.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: You were in Russia? How was it?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Angry.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: (to Cat) The Russian President is furious. As long as we harbor Kal El it looks like we are condoning his actions. While he's flying around dishing out his own brand truth and justice the Russian government is accusing us of aiding terrorists. But Ms Lane would have you believe that he's a hero.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (to Cat) The United States government conceded that Kal El not only saved millions of lives here in Metropolis but also the entire planet.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: Yet Ms Lane he couldn't save the 5,000 people that lost their lives right here in our city. A death (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDGE (cont'd) toll that would have been much larger had it not been for the efforts of the city's police and emergency workers. And what part is Kal El playing in the reconstruction of the city? None. It is LexCorp that is fixing that damage that he ultimately caused.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: (dismissive) This isn't a PR piece for LexCorp Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: Just pointing out that your super friend isn't the only one doing good works.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (to Cat) Kal El possesses so much potential as an ally of humanity rather than being labeled an enemy. I believe he's here to help despite what people like Morgan would have you believe.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: (scoffs) You say he's here to help but what has he done? Lex Luthor has poured over 5 billion dollars into the city's infrastructure. Giving many impoverished areas a new lease on life including rebuilding notorious slums like Hob's bay.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: And which is still and enclave of violent criminal organizations which fall under the protection of LexCorp and their lawyers.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: There is no evidence of that and you shouldn't concern yourself with slanderous rumors.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: It isn't a rumor that you and Lex where members of the most notorious gangs ever to come out of Hob's Bay.  18.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: It's no secret that life didn't afford Lex and I quite the opportunities that it did you Ms Lane.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: (interjects) But look at Lex now.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: Exactly Cat. Lex Luthor and LexCorp are the real heroes Metropolis needs. Not some reckless Alien who hides his true intentions from the world.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: He does not like you.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (smiles) Seems like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cat smiles at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: Well that's all we have time for. After the break we will show you exclusive report from our Russian Affairs correspondent Angela Chen. Lois thank you for joining us.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: CAT
dialogues.text: And Morgan. Give my regards to Lex.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: Sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: I think she held her own.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: She always does.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Why haven't you brought her around lately?  19.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Because you both get way too drunk.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: (indignant ) Whatever. You gonna stay the night?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Sure. I got a doctors appointment in the morning anyway.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Ok well take out the garbage before you leave. Clark KISSES his Mother on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Sure Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lois steps off the stage where Edge is having his MICROPH REMOVED.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: Don't feel too bad Lane. TV is a lot different than sitting behind a laptop. This is where I shine.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: If you ever get tired of being Luthor's mouthpiece then maybe you can pursue a career.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: You know if you keep going after him like this Lex might start to take it personal. Lois looks Edge right in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: I couldn't prove the details of Luthor's (emphasises) "aggressive aquisitions' of rival companies. That doesn't mean I stopped looking.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: That's usually when you should.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: Usually my sources don't end up dead.  20.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: Life can be a fragile thing Ms Lane. (smiles) Take care. Edge leaves.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (agitated) Self important asshole. She removes her CELL PHONE from her pocket and turns it o She has a TEXT FROM CLARK. TEXT: In Kansas. Sleeping over.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Ms Lane. Louis looks up from her phone and sees JIMMY OLSEN, a 21 year old PHOTOGRAPHER from the DAILY PLANET. He's BRIGHT EYED, ENTHUSIASTIC and AWKWARD.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (nervous) Mr White sent me down here to meet you. She looks at him, CONFUSED.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: I'm Jimmy. Jimmy Olsen the new photographer. A flash of RECOGNITION crosses Lois' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: Right Jenny's brother. (starts to walk) I remember now. Jimmy follows her periodically SKIPPING to keep up with h STRIDE.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: Why are you even here?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (awkwardly) Mr White sent me because you turned your phone off and I was to tell you not to say anything bad about Lex Luthor. Which I didn't because I left my damn I.D at home and they wouldn't let me past the lobby.  21. Lois smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: They had to call the Planet and by the time I got here you'd already said some stuff.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: Next time then. AWKWARD silence.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: So what now?

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I could drive you. My car's outside.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: I can get home by myself.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I was just asking because it's late and all. For safety you know.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: I don't need a bodyguard Jimmy. It's Metropolis, not Gotham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOTHAM CITY is a vast URBAN SPRAWL. SKYSCRAPERS cast SHAD over the DECREPIT SLUMS that SURROUND it's WEALTHY INNER HUB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARRIE, a 21 year old RED HEAD in THICK FRAMED GLASSES, walks ALONE down the DARK Gotham street. She's frustrated her PHONE is DEAD and it's beginning to RAIN. A CAB passes by. She raises her hand to hail it.

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: It DOESN'T stop.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: Asshole! (she checks her phone again) Goddammit.  22. She HEARS something. A NOISE from up ahead. She pauses, SCANNING the area for any sign of DANGER. There's nothing Just SILENCE. After a moment she looks to her phone again. On it's scre she sees a FLASH of MOVEMENT. She looks up but before she can react she is SNATCHED by UNSEEN ASSAILANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MEN in DIRTY ORANGE JUMPSUITS drag Carrie, who is KICKING and STRUGGLING, into the trash strewn ABANDONED THEATER which is lit by a SOLITARY LIGHT. In the Theater FIVE other MEN in identical jumpsuit huddle by that STAGE beneath a SIXTH MAN, with ROWS of NOTCHED CARVED into his EXPOSED TORSO, who sits atop a CHAIR on the STAGE like a KING on his THRONE. This is SERIAL MURDERER VICTOR ZSASZ these are his ACOLYTES. The five men part as Carrie is thrown roughly to the grou in front of the stage. Zsasz looks down on her with MADNE FILLED EYES. His Acolytes GRIN, GIGGLE and DROOL as their MASTER steps off the stage and approaches the young Gothamite.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (frightened/whispering) Please don't do this! Zsasz smiles. SALIVA drips down his chin as he kneels dow and leans in close. Close enough for her to RECOIL from h FOUL breath.

dialogues.speaker: ZSASZ
dialogues.text: (with relish) You are whispering. My students didn't bring you here to whisper. Carrie's eyes BUG OUT when she sees the RAZOR SHARP DAGGE Zsasz produces and brings it up to her CHEEK.

dialogues.speaker: ZSASZ, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: No matter. You'll scream. (nicks her cheek) Soon enough. Carrie KICKS her LEGS at the AMUSED Serial Killer. She is RESTRAINED by the Acolytes.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: (SCREAMS)

dialogues.speaker: ZSASZ
dialogues.text: (smiles) Good. Good. (he licks the blood of the blade) That's a start. Acolyte#1 notices SOMETHING above him. He looks up but before he can make out what it is he is PULLED from the floor and DISAPPEARS into the DARKNESS above. Zsasz and his Acolytes FREEZE. WHAM! CRACK! -- Acolyte#1 wails in PAIN before being SLAM down into the ground HARD. He lays there UNCONSCIOUS and BLOODIED. A SHAPE descends from the DARKNESS above them. Acolytes #2 and #3 have no time to react. Acolyte#2's kne is BLOWN OUT as Acolyte#3's jaw is SHATTERED by a devastating blow. Both me CRUMBLE to the ground. Acolyte#4 SWINGS and IRON BAR at the SHADOWY FIGURE. He i DISARMED and the bar is SLAMMED into his STERNUM. He fall to the floor CLUTCHING his CHEST. Acolyte#5 tries to RUN but the bar IMPACTS him across his back SAVAGELY and he FALLS to the floor. The DARK FIGURE steps into the LIGHT. Carrie SCURRIES backward against the wall and sees the SYMBOL. BLACK against GREY... A BAT. Standing above the BEATEN and CRIPPLED bodies is GOTHAM'S GUARDIAN, THE DARK KNIGHT... THE BATMAN. His eyes NARROW as he focuses on his PREY, Zsasz. He step forward. Acolytes #6 and #7 pull their BLADES and ATTACK. #6's arm is SNAPPED like a TWIG. He tries to SCREAM but can't as his face is SMASHED into the CONCRETE FLOOR. #7 SWINGS WIDELY and the Batman effortlessly DODGES every attack with GRACE and SPEED. His reply is CRUSHING. Two BRUTAL STRIKES to the JAW and finished by a STOMACH CHURNING KICK to the GUT which send #7 down. HARD.

dialogues.speaker: ZSASZ, (0.S)
dialogues.text: (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: STAY WHERE YOU ARE
dialogues.text: Zsasz holds Carrie CLOSE. His BLADE against her THROAT.  24.

dialogues.speaker: ZSASZ, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (menacing) You move and I open her up! Batman stands motionless, SILENT. Zsasz smiles as he PRESSES the KNIFE against her SKIN. Li GLITTERS across the BLADE.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE
dialogues.text: (whispers/to Batman) Please... A RAZOR SHARP BATARANG appears in Batman's hand.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: help! Batman throws his weapon. His aim is accurate and it SLIC across the MEAT of Zsasz SHOULDER, CUTTING him DEEPLY. He SCREAMS. Taking the BLADE away from Carrie's neck. She ELBOWS him in the CHEST and STUMBLES FORWARD holding THROAT. Batman CATCHES her. Zsasz clutches his MUTILATED shoulder and flees the Theat Carrie looks into Batman's COLD, EMOTIONLESS eyes. Her ha slowly comes away from her throat. She's CUT. But superficially. He lets her go and FOLLOWS Zsasz out of the Theater. She stands SILENT. Watching him in AWE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zsasz runs toward a PARKED VAN. He opens the driver side door and gets inside. Sitting SLUMPED in the passenger SEAT is a DEAD MAN. His THROAT h been CUT. In the back of the Van are TWO MORE ACOLYTES. Each have MACHINE GUNS.

dialogues.speaker: ACOLYTE
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: ZSASZ
dialogues.text: (seething) The Bat. They exchange WORRIED glances.  25. Zsasz starts the engine and SLAMS his FOOT on the GAS. Th Van TEARS off down the street. Batman APPEARS and produces a GRAPPLING GUN from his UTIL BELT. He AIMS at the Van and FIRES. The Hook EMBEDS in the Van's REAR DOORS and Batman RETRAC the LINE and he is PULLED off his feet toward the Van. He lands on the back of the Van and FLIPS onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zsasz realizes that Batman is on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: ZSASZ
dialogues.text: (shouts to Acolytes) He's on the roof! The Acolytes OPEN FIRE through the roof of the Van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets RIP through the Van's roof. Batman NARROWLY avoids the GUNFIRE. He PRESSES a BUTTON on his Utility Belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ALLEYWAY is PITCH BLACK until the GROWL of A POWERFUL ENGINE is accompanied by the ILLUMINATION of TWO HEADLIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acolytes are RELOADING.

dialogues.speaker: ZSASZ
dialogues.text: (angry) | Why won't he die! Batman SLAMS DOWN onto the HOOD and PLANTS a SMALL EXPLOS on the WINDSCREEN. It DETONATES and the screen SHATTERS. Batman GRABS Zsasz by the THROAT. The Acolytes FIRE on The Dark Knight. The Bullets TEAR through his CAPE. Batman releases Zsasz and RUNS up onto the roof as the Acolytes fire at him through the roof. Zsasz GRIPS his neck and looks in the SIDE MIRROR and see HEADLIGHTS in the distance behind him. Coming up FAST.  26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing in the Van, ENGINE GROWLING, is an ARMORED BLACK CAR. The BATMOBILE. Batman JUMPS from the Van and LANDS on top of his Car as it's door SWINGS OPEN and he JUMPS inside. Zsasz Van picks up SPEED. The rear doors SWING OPEN and both Acolytes OPEN FIRE on Batmobile. Their bullets RICOCHET off the vehicles ARMORED EXTERIOR. Zsasz takes a SHARP corner. Acolyte#8 LOSES his BALANCE and FALLS from the Van. He SL into the asphalt and ROLLS limply down the street. The Batmobile SWERVES HARD to avoid running over the down Acolyte. Acolyte#9, unperturbed, continues to fire on the Batmobil Suddenly the Batmobile TURBO BOOSTS and OVERTAKES Zsasz's VAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zsasz watches as the Batmobile passes him and VANISHES in the night. He eyes BULGE as ahead of him the Batmobile has come to a ABRUPT HALT. He SLAMS on the BREAKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zsasz's Van HITS the armored Batmobile HARD and JACKKNIFE over it and CRASHES. The Van SKIDS along the TARMAC sending SPARKS flying befo coming to a halt. After a moment the Van door CREAKS open and Zsasz CRAWLS BLOODY and GROGGY. He stands, leans against the Van and steadies himself. WHAM! The sound of FIST against FLESH reverberates behind him. Zsasz turns. The Batman stands by the RUINED Van holding the UNCONSCIO Acolyte #9 by the THROAT. He releases his GRIP and the Acolyte FALLS to the ground.  27. The Dark Knight marches forward. His fists CLENCHED. Zsasz pulls his BLADE and ATTACKS. With LIGHTNING SPEED the Killer SLASHES and STABS at Batm The Dark Knight DODGES and PARRIES before GRABBING the Killer's FOREARM.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: (calm) 2 Men. He BREAKS Zsasz's arm. The Killer SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (angry) 4 women. He PUNCHES Zsasz in the STOMACH sending him to his knees, COUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (angrier) 5 children. He CRACKS him across the JAW. Zsasz LAUGHS and SMILES through CRACKED, BLOODSTAINED TEE
(coughs) 6 children. Batman's eyes fill with HATE. He SNATCHES Zsasz's WINDPIPE and begins to SQUEEZE. In a FRENZY he starts to RAIN DOWN BLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: ONE
dialogues.text: His arm is GRABBED and YANKED back.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (0.S)
dialogues.text: (firmly) That's enough! Batman SPINS around and finds himself FACE to FACE with a MAN, mid 20's, MASKED and DRESSED in BLACK with A DARK BL BIRD SYMBOL on his CHEST. This is DICK GRAYSON, FORMER ROBIN, now NIGHTWING.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTWING, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (serious) He goes back in cuffs. Not a coffin.  28. Batman UNCLENCHES his FIST and looks down on Zsasz's BLOO and SWOLLEN face. Batman DROPS him. The Serial Killer still emits SOFT LAUGHTER through his BUSTED mouth. SIRENS can be heard. Batman PULLS his arm free of Nightwing's GRIP and marches toward the Batmobile. Nightwing watches him leave and DEPARTS before the G.C.P. arrive on the scene.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROOFTOP, TALL BUILDING, GOTHAM --. LATER
dialogues.text: Batman stands on the rooftop looking out into Gotham. WAYNE TOWER can be seen in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTWING, (O.S)
dialogues.text: This has to stop. Nightwing DROPS down onto the roof behind him and REMOVES his MASK. The FORMER ALLIES face each other.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: (unrepentant ) It was less than he deserved.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTWING
dialogues.text: (points his finger accusingly) You don't get to decide that. This is not what we do.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: It's always what I've done.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTWING
dialogues.text: (angered) Bullshit! What happened to the man who would think things through before beating someone to a pulp?

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: (emotionless) He was weak. Lacked conviction.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTWING
dialogues.text: So you're just going to keep this up until what? You kill someone? Or yourself? Batman doesn't answer.  29.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTWING, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: We're not with you anymore. Not Gordon. Not Barbara. Sooner or later the law is going to come after you.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: (turns to leave) I'll be ready for that.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTWING, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (coldly) Or I will.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: (cold) You do what you have to.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTWING
dialogues.text: Maybe if you did what you had to Jason would still be here. Batman STOPS and SPINS around, ANGRY.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: (shouts) You have no right!

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTWING
dialogues.text: (shouts back) I have every right.

dialogues.speaker: BATMAN
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTWING
dialogues.text: (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: YOU FAILED
dialogues.text: Batman has NO answer. Nightwing regains his COMPOSURE.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHTWING, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: What you're doing won't change that. (turns to leave) Stop. Before it's too late. You don't belong out here anymore... Bruce. Nightwing leaves. Batman is left alone to ponder his FORMER friend's ACCUSATIONS. He walks to the edge of the rooftop and removes his COWL revealing the face of BRUCE WAYNE.  30. He's in his early 40's but doesn't look a day beyond 35. Except for his EYES which are OLD beyond his years. The e of of WAR VETERAN who has seen TOO MANY HORRORS. He looks at his BLOOD STAINED FISTS solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the EARLY HOURS of the morning. Clark, wearing his SUIT, steps out onto the PORCH carryin TWO TRASH BAGS. He walks towards the TRASH CANS. Martha, in a BATHROBE steps out onto the porch. She SHIVE in the cold. She pulls her robe tighter.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: It's chilly. Clark smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to wake you.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: Then don't stomp down the stairs in the A.M. I'd hoped you stay for breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I have to be back in Metropolis.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: To see those quacks? I don't like them poking and prodding you.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (smiles as he puts the bags in the trash cans) They're friends Mom. No poking or prodding.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: If you say so. (walks over and kisses him on the cheek) Take care. I'll see you soon.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Can't go to the party without you. I love you Mom.

dialogues.speaker: MARTHA
dialogues.text: I love you too.  31. She steps back as Superman TAKES off and disappears beyon the HORIZON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE THEMYSCIRIAN ROYAL SHIP slowly DOCKS in the METROPOLI MARINA. I0, a TALL, ATHLETHIC WOMAN in her 20's, stands on the DO A RAMP descends from the Boat to the Dock. At the top of the ramps stands a DEVASTATINGLY BEAUTIFUL WOMAN, 20's, whose LONG LOCKS of DARK HAIR BLOW in the FA BREEZE. This is DIANA of THEMYSCIRA, PRINCESS of the AMAZONS. Io KNEELS as Diana descends the ramp. 10 (in Amazonian) Princess Diana.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (in Amazonian) Stand Io. You do not have to bow to me. I am not my Mother. Io stands and Diana embraces her.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It has been too long. 10 I wish we could meet under better circumstances your Highness.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I know. Tell me Io. Tell me what has happened to Mala. Where is our sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ELDERLY PRIESTESS stands over the SEMI CONSCIOUS body ORANA, an AMAZONIAN WARRIOR. Orana has been SEVERELY wounded and is CLINGING to life. Diana is led into the room by Io. The Priestess BOWS as Diana approaches Orana. The Princess CARESSES Orana's face.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (to Io) Who did this?  32. 10 Men came and stole our sisters away. Only Orana returned to us. Tortured and next to death. Diana kneels beside Orana.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Orana. Orana's eyes struggle to focus.

dialogues.speaker: ORANA
dialogues.text: Diana?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I am here sister. You must tell me who did this?

dialogues.speaker: ORANA
dialogues.text: (weak) They kept us in a tomb filled with horrors. (takes a labored breath) Their King kept us prisoner. Orana passes out.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Rest sister. (stands and turns to Io) Who is this King? 10 The one who rules this place. The city bears his mark. We should never have come here. Its a world ruled by animals. Diana looks at her fallen fellow Amazonian.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: We are here because your Queen commands it. We need to find where our sisters are being held. 10 There is one who will give us the location. Io gestures to the Doorway where Morgan Edge stands, GRINNING.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: (cocky) I may not understand the lingo but I figure you might be wondering where the other lady is being kept.  33.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (in English) And you would tell us?

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: Sure. For the right price.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I won't barter for life of one of my sisters.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: Then your sister won't have life much longer. Suddenly A GOLDEN LASSO is WHIPPED around Edge's neck and is PULLED to his knees. The Lasso begins to GLOW with GOLDEN ELECTRICITY. Edge's EYES begin to GLOW

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Is my sister alive?

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: (hypnotic) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Where do they keep her?

dialogues.speaker: EDGE
dialogues.text: Lexcorp Research and development. Three miles south outside the city limits. Diana REMOVES the Lasso. Edge holds his neck.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (confused) What did you do to me?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I let you live. (to Io) Get this beast out of my sight. Io picks Edge from the floor and escorts him, ROUGHLY, ou Diana GRIPS the Lasso TIGHT with BOTH HANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S.T.A.R LABS is a HUGE CIRCULAR BUILDING located near the METROPOLIS HARBOR.  34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAIN LABORATORY is a VAST room littered with COMPUTER MONITORS and SCIENCE EQUIPMENT beneath a GIANT SKYLIGHT. SUNLIGHT fills the room. HEAD SCIENTIST PROFESSOR SILAS STONE, 50's, is compiling DATA on his TABLET. T.O MORROW, a SCIENTIST in his 50's sits at his computer screen monitoring SATELLITE FEEDS. He notices something o his screen.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: (to Silas) He's here.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Good. Open the skylight. Morrow presses a few keys on his computer and the GLASS R opens up.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOTCE, (0.S)
dialogues.text: He's late. Silas turns and smiles at COLONEL JOHN STEWART. A TALL, BROAD SHOULDERED FORMER MARINE. His UNIFORM is EMBLAZONED with a S.T.A.R Labs logo on his SHOULDER.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: You need to tell him to keep to the schedule if we don't want the higher ups to find out about our arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: I'm sure he has his reasons.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: I'm sure we'll hear about it on the news. HOVERING just above the Skylight is Superman. He floats d into the middle of the room.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: (to Silas) Professor Stone. (to Stewart) John.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: Kal. Silas notices the DAMAGED suit.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Long night?  35.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: Long year.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: (annoyed) You where scheduled over an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: (apologetic) Sorry. I had dinner with my Mom. Silas smiles. Stewart RAISES an EYEBROW.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Follow me. Superman follows Silas through the Laboratory and towards RESEARCH CENTER. Morrow walks over to Stewart and hands him a Tablet.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: Take a look at this. Stewart looks it over. It's a NEWS ARTICLE. IT READS: SUPERMAN ATTACKS RUSSIAN TROOPS.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: (weary) Swell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superman is SHIRTLESS and laying on a TABLE. Attached to his CHEST are ELECTRODES which send INFORMATI to Silas' MONITOR.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: (in awe) ) It's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Kryptonian physiology. So different yet so similar to our own. I can never get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Took me 30 years.  36.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Your vitals are perfect. Heart rate, blood pressure, brain activity. All perfect. Yet still you haven't tapped your full potential. (turns off the monitor) There is so much we can learn from you. So much that could benefit us.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: Not everybody shares that enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Not everybody has vision Kal or can see past their fears. Which is understandable. Once the gods were above us and now they walk among us. It's a frightening concept for most.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: The ones who are attacking the oil rigs. They're not like me but they're not like you either. Something else entirely. I know it's hard to believe.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: I believe you. Silas sits down beside the Man of Steel.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: Not everything remarkable on this Earth comes from elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: That we are at a dawning of a new age. An age of Gods and Monsters.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: You're not frightened.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Not when you stand for us. Silas stands and puts his hand on Superman shoulder. Superman puts his hand on his.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: Come on. I have something to show you.  37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Superman follows Silas to through the RED ROOM. A TOP SEC section of S.T.A.R Labs that houses varying kinds of EXPERIMENTAL TECHNOLOGY.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: This is the Red Room. It's where we keep our advancements that for whatever reason the greater public isn't quit ready for yet. They come to a LARGE CONTAINMENT CAPSULE.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: Here it is. Silas inputs a code into the KEYPAD on it's side. It open with a HISS. Inside is a BLUE BODY SUIT.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: It's a prototype for a new space suit. Highly durable yet very flexible. We'll have to make a few changes but I'd like you to have it.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: I can't accept this. You've already taken too many risks.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: You have to. (gestures to the tears in Superman's suit) We can't have the savior of the world in rags.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: (concedes) Thank you Silas.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: We'll have it finished before I leave for Washington. I do wish you'd come with me. Speaking to the President would help your cause.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: I want to address the Leaders of the World as a whole before I speak to them individually.  They walk 38.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: I understand. (He closes the Capsule) The Conference. Do you think you're ready?

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: I think so. It's been a year. At this point they will have to accept me.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Still hopeful I see. And if they don't?

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: Well that's up to them. I'll continue trying to help regardless. Will you be there?

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Of course. I was hoping to bring my son but he has other things on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: The big game?

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Every game is a big game to Victor. I suppose it has to be when your a quarterback. towards the exit.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: I'd imagine you'd have made quite the player yourself.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: My Mother wouldn't let me.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Afraid you'd hurt someone?

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMAN
dialogues.text: She was afraid they'd hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: (laughs) I don't think there's anything out there that can hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROJECT CADMUS is a large UNDERGROUND LABORATORY.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: SASHA FEDEROV, a CHECHNYAN SCIENTIST, stands in front of a giant INCUBATION CHAMBER which is a REVERSE  39. ENGINEERED KRYPTONIAN GENESIS CHAMBER. He looks on the CONTENTS of the Chamber with a mix of PRI and AWE. FLOATING in the Chamber is a HUMANOID FORM which is COVER in GREY MUSCLE TISSUE and SINEWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEXCORP PLAZA is a TALL OFFICE BUILDING in DOWNTOWN METROPOLIS. The MARBLE SIGN in it's COURTYARD READS: 'LEXCORP PLAZA.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (0.S)
dialogues.text: (angry) . Are you out of your damn mind?

dialogues.speaker: PLAZA
dialogues.text: PERRY WHITE, the EDITOR IN CHIEF, SLAMS a STACK of PAPERS down on his desk. He's PISSED. Lois stands in front of him, DEFIANT.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: You go after Lex Luthor on national television? What the hell were you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (unrepentant ) It was a debate. I was defending my position.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: By slandering Metropolis' favorite son? How do expect to rally support from the public when you're trying to crucify Metropolis' favorite son?

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: Morgan Edge has been taking every opportunity to turn what happened into a PR stunt for Lexcorp. All on the basis that Kal is a threat to the world.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: And he isn't?

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: You know he isn't.  40.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: I know what he did for us. I also know what happened despite that. People are still scared and if you want to change that pursuing old grudges isn't the way to do it.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: It's not about that.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: It's been about that for the last 5 years Louis. Let it go.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: My investigation got a man killed. Would you let it go?

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: (sighs) You can't touch him Lois. Nobody can. (he turns and stares out the window in deep thought ) I grew up in Hob's Bay Louis. I know the type of person that survives a place like that. what that person is capable of. (turns back to Lois) Luthor runs the show. It's not by chance were in a building he owns. At anytime he could buy the Planet right out from under us. You keep this up and he will bury us. You can't fight this battle on two fronts. Lois weighs Perry's comments.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (reluctant ) I'll back off. For now.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: (firmly) For good. (takes his seat) I want you to cover the Conference.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: I told you I won't.

dialogues.speaker: PERRY
dialogues.text: It's non negotiable Lois. It's the largest gathering of world leaders this city has ever seen. And they are here to see Superman. You have to be there.  41.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: This isn't fair Perry.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Clark, wearing his GLASSES, sits at his desk eaves droppi on Perry and Lois' conversation with his SUPER HEARING. Jimmy sits on the desk beside him eating a bowl of nachos Jimmy is talking but Clark isn't paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Clark? Clark realizes that Jimmy has asked him a question.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Sorry Jimmy I zoned out there for a second. What was that?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I asked have you seen him up close?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: who?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Who do you think? Superman. I been talking about him for the last 5 minutes. Honestly buddy you need to get your hearing checked.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: No. I didn't start working until after the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Damn. I want to see him in action. You know last month he stopped a cruise liner from sinking. Clark turns his attention back to Perry's office where he can see Lois and Perry's ARGUMENT getting very HEATED.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (disinterested) Sounds neat. Lois STORMS out of Perry's office, SLAMMING the door behi her. EVERYONE in the bullpen STOPS and STARES.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: Lois?

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (angry) | Not now Smallville!  42. Clark stands, grabs his coat and CHASES after Lois. He clumsily BUMPS into people as he does.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (awkward) Sorry! Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark catches up with Lois as she exits the Plaza doors.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (concerned) Hold on. Whats wrong? Lois stops.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: Don't pretend that you didn't hear everything.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: I thought it would be more polite to ask.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: This is such a bad idea. Someone else needs to cover that Conference.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: It's not like you to be afraid of a few world leaders.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: I don't need to watch you get crucified by a bunch of scared bureaucrats. Are you sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: No. (smiles) But I have to try. She HUGS him tight laying her head on his chest. He WRAPS his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: We'll figure this out.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: I know. (smiles) ) Fly me to Cancun?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (laughs) Sure.  43. They link arms and stroll down the BUSY street past BILLBOARDS that ADVERTISE LexCorp's latest COMPUTER SOFTW

dialogues.speaker: CLARK, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: My Mother's coming into town.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (genuine) Really?.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: That's not an excuse to get liquored up.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: Your Mother's a bad influence.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: You influence each other. They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: I want to take her to the Spire opening.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: I don't know why you even want to go to Luthor's Ball.

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: Mom's a country girl she's never been to a high society event. She'd love it. Plus it's an excuse to wear a suit.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: Clark Kent in a suit? I can't imagine it. He smiles before his ATTENTION is drawn to a CROWD of PEO that are GATHERED near a WALL. He stops. Lois looks CONCERNED.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (solemn) Clark don't. Clark gives her a PAINED look and walks toward the crowd. He makes his way through and sees the wall is COVERED by HUNDREDS of PHOTOS and KEEPSAKES. It's a MEMORIAL to the LIVES LOST a year before. Clark SCANS the wall. He sees MEN... WOMEN... CHILDREN... FATHERS... MOTHERS... SONS... DAUGHTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TURMOIL is evident on Clark's face. Lois TOUCHES his arm gently.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: Clark?

dialogues.speaker: CLARK
dialogues.text: (overwhelmed) There's so many.

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: (softly) I know. Come on. Clark takes one last LOOK over his shoulder as Lois LEADS him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES DIANE NELSON, a tall, slender woman in her 50's, sits behind desk. Her SERIOUS eyes drifting back and forth between the three people sitting in front of her. GENERAL SWANWICK, Head of the UNITED STATES NORTHERN COMMAND, sits to her right along with Silas Stone and to left is... AMANDA WALLER, a STERN and FOCUSED SENATOR with an INTIMIDATING PRESENCE.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT NELSON
dialogues.text: So what are our options?

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: Honestly very few. The world is watching our every move on the Superman. We have to take a definitive action.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT NELSON
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: (forthright) Engagement.

dialogues.speaker: SWANWICK
dialogues.text: I must advice against this course of action. Superman has in my opinion more than proved himself as an ally.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: (to Swanwick) He's proved himself as a liability. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALLER (cont'd) (to President) Russia is pushing for some sort of action and if we don't act now we risk looking weak.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT NELSON
dialogues.text: What do you suggest? She hands her a THICK FILE stamped: CADMUS The President FLIPS through it.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT NELSON, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: What am I looking at here?

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: Last year we recovered several items from Metropolis after the attack. Two items in particular. An advanced incubation system and a body. Which Cadmus Cadmus has managed to successfully duplicate the Alien D.N.A The President looks INTRIGUED. Swanwick looks SURPRISED.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT NELSON
dialogues.text: Which means?

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: Which means Ma'am why worry about a Superman when we can have our own.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: (to Waller) You and I both know the results of Cadmus are inconclusive at best.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: (dismissive) I have assurances from the head of the project Professor Sasha Federov the worlds foremost authority on genetic engineering that a subject is ready for field testing.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT NELSON
dialogues.text: Does S.T.A.R Labs have any alternatives?

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: We are researching several courses of action. None of which involve weaponizing alien technology.  46.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: (to Swanwick) Courses of action that are leading to nothing. (to President) Mrs President the world is changing. I and I'm sure S.T.A.R Labs have been monitoring several occurrences all over the world. The attacks on oil platforms by terrorists whose technology is something we have never encountered before. Reports of an entity in Central City that moves faster than sound. Cadmus can counter these very real threats. All we need is your signature. The President PONDERS her decision as she reads the file.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT NELSON
dialogues.text: Why am I only hearing about this now?

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: Up until a few months ago there was nothing to tell. Just research, experimentation, no concrete results.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT NELSON
dialogues.text: Who's. funding this project?

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: Several different institutions.

dialogues.speaker: SWANWICK
dialogues.text: I must advice against this Mrs President.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT NELSON
dialogues.text: (to Swanwick) I had the Russian President on the phone for over three hours this morning General Swanwick. We need solution and I believe Ms Waller has provided us with one Waller smiles SELF SATISFIED.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT NELSON
dialogues.text: I can't give you a definitive answer until after the conference. but as of now... (places the file on her desk) You have my support.  47.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: Thank you Mrs President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stewart stands outside the Oval Office doors. The doors open. Waller leaves the Office followed by Swanwick and Stone.

dialogues.speaker: SWANWICK
dialogues.text: _ (angry) This is unacceptable Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: I'm just doing what you would in my position. (turns to Silas and smiles) Don't presume to think that I'm unaware of the Alien's relationship with S.T.A.R Labs Professor Stone.

dialogues.speaker: SWANWICK
dialogues.text: Cadmus is a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: Cadmus will make sure that Superman will think long and hard before acting against our interests. The game has changed. There's a living weapon patrolling our skies and it's about time we had our own. (turns away and walks down the hallway) This is an arms race and I intend to win. Swanwick is FRUSTRATED.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: (to Swanwick) Who's your new girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: SWANWICK
dialogues.text: Amanda Waller.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: So that's the 'Wall'?

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Who's funding Cadmus?

dialogues.speaker: SWANWICK
dialogues.text: I have no idea Silas.  48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stone and Stewart leave the White House grounds and walk towards a waiting CAR and DRIVER. Standing by the Car is a Silas' Son VICTOR STONE. A STAR QUARTERBACK. He wears a METROPOLIS UNIVERSITY JACKET.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: (concerned) We need a strategy Silas.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: I know John. I didn't see this coming. Cadmus is off the books.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: Black Ops?

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: No. It's privately funded. And that's whats worrying me.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: The only person with that the resources is...

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: A big problem John. Victor opens the back passenger seat for his Father.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: (to Victor) How's the arm Vic?

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Like a cannon.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: Better be I got money on you.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Then you'll be buying the drinks after man.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS
dialogues.text: Come on Victor. Victor gets in beside his Father and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: SILAS, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (to Stewart) I'll see you in Metropolis. The Car pulls off.  49.

dialogues.speaker: METROPOLIS OUTSKIRTS
dialogues.text: A LEXCORP HELICOPTER LANDS on the HELIPAD atop the SPRAWL LEXCORP RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT COMPLEX located just outside the CITY LIMITS. The Complex is HEAVILY GUARDED by ARMED LEXCORP SECURITY GUARDS who stand at each CORNER of the Helipad. MERCY GRAVES, late 20's, a STRIKING WOMAN in a BUSINESS SUIT. steps out onto the Building where she is greeted by BRUNO, the HEAD of SECURITY, who is FLANKED by TWO SUITED SECURITY GUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: (faux politeness) It's always good to see you Mercy.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (smiles) A pleasant lie Bruno, but a lie nonetheless. BRUNO. Well I tried.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: And like everything in your life you'll have to try a little harder.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: So why are you slumming it with the grunts?

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: I'm overseeing the disposal of the material.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNO
dialogues.text: I see. Well better you than me. Don't wait on around on my account. He gestures toward the HELPIPAD ENTRANCE. Mercy enters the the Complex. Bruno and the Suited Guards follow. A HOODED and CLOAKED FIGURE DASHES at AMAZING SPEED throu the GROUNDS and JUMPS HIGH through the air and lands ON T of the COMPLEX in the MIDDLE of the Helipad. Before the Guards have time to REACT the Figure STRIKES, DISARMS and INCAPACITATES them. The Figure REMOVES her hood to REVEAL Diana in a SLEEK BO SUIT as the WONDER WOMAN.  50.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Mercy, Bruno and the Guards walk down the STERILE WHITE HALLWAY followed by the Security Detail. SUDDENLY the LASSO is WRAPPED around Bruno's NECK and he DRAGGED backwards OFF HIS FEET. Mercy turns to see Bruno SMASH VIOLENTLY into the WALL at the end of the Hallway. Wonder Woman TAKES OUT the Security with TwO SWIFT KICKS. They SLAM into the walls and to the FLOOR UNCONSCIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: _ (angry) . You just made the last mistake of your life. Mercy PULLS a GUN which Wonder Woman WHIPS out of her han Like LIGHTNING Mercy ATTACKS the Amazon with a series of PUNCHES and KICKS which are all BLOCKED. Wonder Woman COUNTERS with a KICK to Mercy's GUT which se her backwards. Mercy, DEFEATED, tries to RUN but CLUTCHES at her THROAT the Lasso WHIPS around her neck. It GLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: WONDER WOMAN
dialogues.text: (menacing) You hold one of my people prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (hypnotic) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: WONDER WOMAN
dialogues.text: Take me to her.

dialogues.speaker: -- CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Mercy, still under the Lasso's THRALL, stands with Wonder Woman outside the GLASS DOORS of a LABORATORY deep beneat the Research Center.

dialogues.speaker: WONDER WOMAN
dialogues.text: Open it. Mercy places her hand on a SCANNER beside the door. It RECOGNIZES her PALM PRINT and the doors SLIDE OPEN. Wonder Woman PUSHES Mercy inside. Inside the room is a LIQUID FILLED TANK where MALA, late 20's, FLOATS UNCONSCIOUS.  51. A SCIENTIST, 40's, STANDS SHOCKED as he watches Wonder Wo DRAG Mercy towards the Tank.

dialogues.speaker: WONDER WOMAN
dialogues.text: (to Scientist) Release her!

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: (frightened) I can't! The Amazon WHIPS the Lasso from Mercy who falls to her kn and around the Scientist's NECK.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (hypnotic) I can! The Scientist operates the Tank and the liquid is DRAINED from it. The Tank OPENS and Wonder Woman RUSHES to CATCH Mala befo she FALLS to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: WONDER WOMAN
dialogues.text: Mala! Mala's eyes SLOWLY OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: MALA
dialogues.text: (in Amazonian, groggy, confused) Diana?

dialogues.speaker: WONDER WOMAN
dialogues.text: (in Amazonian) I've come to take you home. She LIFTS Mala of her feet CARRYING her out of the Laboratory. After she leaves Mercy, holding her throat, turns to the cowering Scientist.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (horse) Why are you standing there. Sound the alarm!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: The ALARMS are RINGING throughout the Complex. CRASH!!! -- the ENTRANCE DOORS SHATTER as TWO SECURITY GUARDS are TOSSED through them. Wonder Woman EMERGES from the Entrance CARRYING Mala in h ARMS.  52. She RUNS at INCREDIBLE SPEED away from the Complex as GUA on the Roof OPEN FIRE on her. When she comes to the PERIMETER FENCE she JUMPS over it, CLEARING it by 40 FEET. She LANDS and VANISHES into the NIGHT. Mercy appears on the Roof, SEETHING as she RUBS her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder Woman lays Mala down a RIVER.

dialogues.speaker: WONDER WOMAN
dialogues.text: Rest Sister. You're safe now.

dialogues.speaker: MALA
dialogues.text: (frail) He wants to kill him. He hates him so much.

dialogues.speaker: WONDER WOMAN
dialogues.text: Who? Who are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MALA
dialogues.text: He wants to kill their New God. He wants to kill the Superman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne Manor is a HUGE 19th CENTURY ERA MANSION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALFRED, 70's, is an ELDERLY but still very SPRY BRITISH BUTLER walks down the hallway towards Bruce Wayne's STUDY carrying a tray of food. Inside he approaches an ANCIENT GRANDFATHER CLOCK and TURNS the hands to 10:48 then -- CL -- the clock UNLOCKS and PULLS AWAY from the wall reveali a HIDDEN DOORWAY. He enters. The Clock RETURNS to it's original position behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfred walks down a STONE STAIRCASE illuminated by a seri of LIGHTS on the ROCK CEILING above. BATS SCREECH past ov head as he descends further down into the VAST CAVERN. THE BATCAVE is huge. Housed inside the vast EXPANSE is an array of HI-TECH GADGETS and WEAPONRY. Old now, showing signs of WEAR and TEAR after YEARS of use. Alfred passes the parked Batmobile. In the back of the Cave sitting atop a LANDING PAD is the BATWING. A JET which is covered in DIRT and DUST from yea of IDLENESS.  53. Alfred makes his way up a set of steps to an ELEVATED PLATFORM where Bruce Wayne sits in front of THREE LARGE COMPUTER MONITORS. Each screen tells a different news sto RIGHT SCREEN: SERIAL KILLER VICTOR ZSASZ APPREHENDED. MIDDLE SCREEN: SUPERMAN ATTACKS RUSSIAN TROOPS.

dialogues.speaker: LEFT SCREEN
dialogues.text: Bruce is FOCUSED on the MIDDLE SCREEN. Alfred puts the tray on the desk beside the computer screens.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: I brought you some dinner Master Bruce. One must never obsess on an empty stomach. Bruce glances at the food but doesn't reply. Alfred looks at the images on screen and sees Superman HOVERING above Metropolis in SHAKY AMATEUR FOOTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: If the criminals of Gotham are lacking your interest might I suggest turning your attention to Central City's rogues before tackling an alien. Wayne still doesn't reply.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: (weary) Try and eat something. He turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: I saw Grayson. Alfred STOPS when he hears the NAME.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: He's turned his back on me. They all have.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: (honestly) He's turned his back on the part of you that reminds him of what we've lost.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: He hates me.  54.

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: It's not hate Master Bruce it's hurt. He mourns the brother and blames the father.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: And who do you blame?

dialogues.speaker: ALFRED
dialogues.text: I blame the one who took him. Not the one who loved him. (Alfred puts his hand on Bruce's shoulder) But I do regret the loss of a man who sought diplomacy over violence. I miss that man. (beat ) Everything's ready for your visit to Metropolis He SQUEEZES Bruce's shoulder before leaving. Bruce is still for a moment before standing and walking o to a LARGE GLASS DISPLAY CASE. Inside the case is a DARK RED and BLACK TACTICAL ARMOR (CHEST PIECE, GLOVES, BOOTS) which stands beneath a DARK GREEN HOODED CLOAK and a BLACK FACE MASK. Bruce places his hand on the glass and stands for a momen His WEARY eyes filled with the HURT of a FATHER who has l a SON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HALLWAY is DARK. ELEVATOR DOORS open ILLUMINATING the Hallway. Amanda Waller steps out and walks down the Hallway toward two HUGE REINFORCED DOORS. Her footsteps ECHO as she does When she arrives at the door she faces A CONTROL PANEL. S SPEAKS into it.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: (into control panel) Waller, Amanda. Clearance MOS 17 The Reinforced Doors OPEN UP slowly revealing the CLONING FACILITY. Waller steps inside and the doors close behind her. Federov, SURPRISED, rushes toward her.

dialogues.speaker: FEDEROV
dialogues.text: Mrs. Waller. I wasn't aware you'd scheduled a visit.  55.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: I didn't. I'm here in an unofficial capacity. I wanted to get a closer look at what we're making here. Federov nods, SHEEPISHLY. Waller walks toward the Incubation Chamber.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER, (CON'T)
dialogues.text: When will it be ready?

dialogues.speaker: FEDEROV
dialogues.text: On schedule.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: This project is a big risk Federov. I can't afford any mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: FEDEROV
dialogues.text: I promise you our subject will be perfect. It's my finest work.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: Show me. Federov presses a few BUTTONS on the Chamber's CONTROL PA and the screen RAISES revealing its CONTENTS. Waller is visibly UNIMPRESSED by the Creature.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: It doesn't look like much to me Federov.

dialogues.speaker: FEDEROV
dialogues.text: Relatively speaking neither does Superman but then again you're not here for aesthetic.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: I'm here for results which this...

dialogues.speaker: FEDEROV
dialogues.text: (with pride) Ultimate.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: Ultimate can provide.

dialogues.speaker: FEDEROV
dialogues.text: Trust me. You won't be disappointed. The Ultimate is superior to the Superman in every way.  56.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: It had better be if and when the Alien goes rogue. (leans in close to look at the Creature) I've seen enough. Federov closes the Chamber.

dialogues.speaker: FEDEROV
dialogues.text: General Swanwick has been demanding access to the Project.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: Swanwick is a fool. A decrepit relic that can't see beyond the barrel of his gun. He thinks. he has his weapon and doesn't want anyone else to have theirs.

dialogues.speaker: FEDEROV
dialogues.text: He does have authority.

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: The only authority here is me Federov. I'll deal with Swanwick you focus on getting your Ultimate operational. She starts to walk towards the doors.

dialogues.speaker: FEDEROV
dialogues.text: So what to I tell him?

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: Only what you're allowed to.

dialogues.speaker: FEDEROV
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: WALLER
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A M.C.P.D PATROL CAR is parked outside of LEXCORP TOWER, HUGE SKYSCRAPER. Sitting in the Car is OFFICER JAMES HARPER, a BROAD SHOULDERED COP in his 40's. The passenger door opens and partner GUY GARDNER, an ATHLETIC MAN in his late 20's. He has COFFEE CUPS and DONUTS.

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER
dialogues.text: That's a strong black coffee for me and... (hands Harper his cup) And a decaf green tea for Grandma.  57. Harper takes the cup.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: Witty.

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER
dialogues.text: Donut?

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: No thanks. I brought a salad. Harper opens up a CONTAINER full of LEAFY GREENS and GRIL CHICKEN.

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. VAN passes them. Harper looks at it with DISDAIN.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: Would you look at that. He's everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER
dialogues.text: (eating his donut) who?

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
dialogues.text: Who do you think? Luthor. He's got his damn trucks and billboards everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: GARDNER
dialogues.text: It's always been like that Jim. Far as I remember.

dialogues.speaker: HARPER
